alert.note: Alert for Atchison (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 15 at 7:07AM CDT until May 15 at 11:00AM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pleasant Hill has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Atchison County in northeastern Kansas... * Until 1100 AM CDT. * At 707 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to two inches of rain have already fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flooding include... Atchison, Effingham, Lancaster, Farmington and Cummings. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
